net.sf.mmm.client.ui.api.widget.core

Interface UiWidgetSection

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AbstractValidatableObject, Accessibility, AttributeReadAriaRole, AttributeReadDisposed, AttributeReadEnabled, AttributeReadHtmlId, AttributeReadId<String>, AttributeReadLabel, AttributeReadMode, AttributeReadModeFixed, AttributeReadModified, AttributeReadPrimaryStyle, AttributeReadStyles, AttributeReadStylesAdvanced, AttributeReadTooltip, AttributeReadVisible, AttributeReadVisibleRecursive, AttributeWriteDisposed, AttributeWriteEnabled, AttributeWriteHtmlId, AttributeWriteId<String>, AttributeWriteLabel, AttributeWriteMode, AttributeWriteModeFixed, AttributeWritePrimaryStyle, AttributeWriteStyles, AttributeWriteStylesAdvanced, AttributeWriteTooltip, AttributeWriteVisible, AttributeWriteVisibleAdvanced, UiFeature, UiFeatureEvent, UiFeatureMessages, UiFeatureMode, UiWidget, UiWidgetNative, UiWidgetRegular
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractUiWidgetSection, UiWidgetSectionGwt, UiWidgetSectionTestImpl

    public interface UiWidgetSection
extends UiWidgetRegular, AttributeWriteLabel, UiWidgetNative
    This is the interface for a regular widget that represents a section. A section is a widget that displays a short text in a single line. The text is supposed to be a title that explains the content below. This is an alternative approach to a UiWidgetBorderPanel.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Joerg Hohwiller (hohwille at users.sourceforge.net)

        static final String STYLE_PRIMARY

    • Method Detail

      • getAriaRole

        RoleHeading getAriaRole()
        This method gets the Accessibility.WAI_ARIA role of this object.
        ATTENTION:
        A reasonable UI framework (e.g. when using UiWidget) is supposed to provide high-level widgets and support setting the according Role and their attributes automatically. Therefore users should only use this for special situations e.g. for setting aria-hidden intentionally for a visible object.
        Specified by:
        getAriaRole in interface AttributeReadAriaRole
        Returns:
        the Role or null if NOT set.
        See Also:
        Accessibility
